ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Functionalities to automatically generate interactive visualizations for popular statistical results supported by 'ggfortify', such as time series, PCA, clustering and survival analysis, with 'plotly.js' <https://plot.ly/> and 'ggplot2' style. The generated visualizations can also be easily extended using 'ggplot2' and 'plotly' syntax while staying interactive.

Functionalities to automatically generate interactive visualizations for popular statistical results supported by 'ggfortify', such as time series, PCA, clustering and survival analysis, with 'plotly.js' <https://plot.ly/> and 'ggplot2' style. The generated visualizations can also be easily extended using 'ggplot2' and 'plotly' syntax while staying interactive.

name: r-autoplotly
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.1.4" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-autoplotly
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/autoplotly_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/autoplotly/autoplotly_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 81aeb1fb24e9ed1f29ad9d8c98f6ce93423c9a4107f4f391003fbea6b63ca7fc

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - r-base
    - r-ggfortify
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-plotly

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ggfortify
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-plotly

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('autoplotly')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('autoplotly')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/terrytangyuan/autoplotly
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: Functionalities to automatically generate interactive visualizations for popular statistical results supported by 'ggfortify', such as time series, PCA, clustering and survival analysis, with 'plotly.js' <https://plot.ly/> and 'ggplot2' style. The generated visualizations can also be easily extended using 'ggplot2'
    and 'plotly' syntax while staying interactive.
  license_family: GPL
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
